definition[0]: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them
example[0]: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
definition[1]: to provide someone with a place to stay, live, or work
example[2]: The island was used to accommodate child refugees.
definition[2]: to accept someone’s opinions and try to do what they want, especially when their opinions or needs are different from yours
example[3]: We’ve made every effort to accommodate your point of view.
definition[3]: to get used to a new situation or to make yourself do this
example[4]: Her eyes took a while to accommodate to the darkness.
